## 

<span key="6c232c96ba2b4367b0af68dba1a0654c"><span offset-key="6c232c96ba2b4367b0af68dba1a0654c:0">1. Install and run Cypress</span></span>

<span key="9ee60a8d3acd42129c379dfbc11d0ae6"><span offset-key="9ee60a8d3acd42129c379dfbc11d0ae6:0">Once Cypress is installed in a project, we can run it with:</span></span>

1

<span key="991915925d1949b5af2f6412aaf30a63"><span offset-key="991915925d1949b5af2f6412aaf30a63:0">$ npx cypress </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="991915925d1949b5af2f6412aaf30a63:1">open</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

<span key="050f2de3e2884447b53cf13ae07aa76a"><span offset-key="050f2de3e2884447b53cf13ae07aa76a:0">This generates a number of tests and files in </span>`./cypress`<span offset-key="050f2de3e2884447b53cf13ae07aa76a:2"> folder, including a folder for integration tests, fixtures, plugins, and support.</span></span>

## 

<span key="380ccd6b982044d7b28aa4a1d38eeb4d"><span offset-key="380ccd6b982044d7b28aa4a1d38eeb4d:0">2. Write the first Cypress Test</span></span>

1

<span key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3"><span offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:0">$ </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:1">npm</span><span offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:2"> run dev </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:3">&</span><span offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:4"> npx cypress </span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="366335070ae7445e9b95a59dfe5189c3:5">open</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="0f72f638e42645c891603273e1456d3b">`calculator.js`</span>

<span key="3615f688d53d486d93cf03eca2e4bcad"><span offset-key="3615f688d53d486d93cf03eca2e4bcad:0">Tests in Cypress need to start with </span>`cy.visit()`<span offset-key="3615f688d53d486d93cf03eca2e4bcad:2"> in order for Cypress to know what to render for integration tests to be written.</span></span>

<span key="be3571006cc74dd2b92fb9e2e597b63d"><span offset-key="be3571006cc74dd2b92fb9e2e597b63d:0">We configure Cypress to test our app using </span>`cy.visit('http://localhost:[port]')`<span offset-key="be3571006cc74dd2b92fb9e2e597b63d:2"> once our server is running.</span></span>

<span key="a9186b0103af42a2addc688d8cf1fa15"><span offset-key="a9186b0103af42a2addc688d8cf1fa15:0">By default, Cypress creates an integration folder in the </span>`cypress`<span offset-key="a9186b0103af42a2addc688d8cf1fa15:2"> folder created when first run.</span></span>

<span key="3bd5c6a23f7a47999df6ff8f36d84a05"><span offset-key="3bd5c6a23f7a47999df6ff8f36d84a05:0">To make it clear that we are writing end-to-end tests, we'll change it to </span>`e2e`<span offset-key="3bd5c6a23f7a47999df6ff8f36d84a05:2">. Cypress won't know about this change until we specify to use the folder. We can do so by adding and </span>`integrationFolder`<span offset-key="3bd5c6a23f7a47999df6ff8f36d84a05:4"> property to our </span>`cypress.json`<span offset-key="3bd5c6a23f7a47999df6ff8f36d84a05:6">.</span></span>

<span key="ddf689fdbc624fde8a87dd024a68541e"><span offset-key="ddf689fdbc624fde8a87dd024a68541e:0">Once Cypress visits our app in the browser, we can select elements to interact with.</span></span>

<span key="69180c84d423462793c070f1cbecfbe0"><span offset-key="69180c84d423462793c070f1cbecfbe0:0">To get an element, we use </span>`.get('.my-selector')`<span offset-key="69180c84d423462793c070f1cbecfbe0:2">. We can trigger a click on it with </span>`.click()`<span offset-key="69180c84d423462793c070f1cbecfbe0:4">. We can run assertions on elements using </span>`.should('[assertion.command]',                                         'value-to-compare')`<span offset-key="69180c84d423462793c070f1cbecfbe0:6">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="d9fdbe0d81d94f66bcd1f41b5e3ee18b"><span offset-key="d9fdbe0d81d94f66bcd1f41b5e3ee18b:0">3. Configure Cypress in cypress.json</span></span>

<span key="228af88ecf494b59a7a12b9f5852dceb"><span offset-key="228af88ecf494b59a7a12b9f5852dceb:0">Cypress can be configured via </span>`cypress.json`<span offset-key="228af88ecf494b59a7a12b9f5852dceb:2">.</span></span>

<span key="912e8b5f68e6414a9acbc3a87ea6af2b"><span offset-key="912e8b5f68e6414a9acbc3a87ea6af2b:0">Instead of passing </span>`http://localhost:8080`<span offset-key="912e8b5f68e6414a9acbc3a87ea6af2b:2"> to all of our tests in </span>`cy.visit()`<span offset-key="912e8b5f68e6414a9acbc3a87ea6af2b:4">, we can configure a </span>`baseUrl`<span offset-key="912e8b5f68e6414a9acbc3a87ea6af2b:6"> property that will be used in our tests, for which we can provide only paths.</span></span>

<span key="b4b2fc7190464ac3be6eadaf7bc7e528"><span offset-key="b4b2fc7190464ac3be6eadaf7bc7e528:0">This solves another problem - by specifying a full URL, Cypress will reload the app every time the test is rerun. Using </span>`baseUrl`<span offset-key="b4b2fc7190464ac3be6eadaf7bc7e528:2"> overcomes this.</span></span>

<span key="630326e6004245828255a0121548eb5a"><span offset-key="630326e6004245828255a0121548eb5a:0">We can move our </span>`calculator.js`<span offset-key="630326e6004245828255a0121548eb5a:2"> test in </span>`cypress/integration`<span offset-key="630326e6004245828255a0121548eb5a:4"> into </span>`cypress/e2e`<span offset-key="630326e6004245828255a0121548eb5a:6"> to better describe the intent of our tests.</span></span>

<span key="40fca2066982450c8b6f5664d8ca5d8f"><span offset-key="40fca2066982450c8b6f5664d8ca5d8f:0">Cypress runs integration tests by default from </span>`cypress/integration`<span offset-key="40fca2066982450c8b6f5664d8ca5d8f:2">, so we'll need to configure the </span>`integrationFolder`</span>

<span key="fa3e8ae353f74c84bea2a6713163db05"><span offset-key="fa3e8ae353f74c84bea2a6713163db05:0">By default Cypress runs apps at 1000x660. We can use the </span>`viewportWidth`<span offset-key="fa3e8ae353f74c84bea2a6713163db05:2"> and </span>`viewportHeight`<span offset-key="fa3e8ae353f74c84bea2a6713163db05:4"> properties in the config to specify our own dimensions.</span></span>

<span key="20de0d0c24ec4647a7c7b900d8338c5c"><span offset-key="20de0d0c24ec4647a7c7b900d8338c5c:0">In Cypress' UI we can view the entire config for the project, including environment variables, plugin overrides, and CLI flags.</span></span>

## 

<span key="e92e0380adc84d74859ca5e793178bd5"><span offset-key="e92e0380adc84d74859ca5e793178bd5:0">4. Installing cypress-testing-library</span></span>

<span key="6fb6e431fb8145e49902bd015494136a"><span offset-key="6fb6e431fb8145e49902bd015494136a:0">Currently the </span>`.get()`<span offset-key="6fb6e431fb8145e49902bd015494136a:2"> commands in our calculator test are pretty nasty. We can leverage </span>`cypress-testing-library`<span offset-key="6fb6e431fb8145e49902bd015494136a:4"> to benefit from commands similar to those in </span>`react-testing-library`<span offset-key="6fb6e431fb8145e49902bd015494136a:6">.</span></span>

<span key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec"><span offset-key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec:0">Once </span>`cypress-testing-library`<span offset-key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec:2"> is installed, we need to extend </span>`cy`<span offset-key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec:4">'s commands. This is done by importing commands into </span>`cypress/support/index.js`<span offset-key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec:6">. We import </span>`cypress-testing-library/add-commands`<span offset-key="2aed605c1b6a4381a31eba4062d9fdec:8"> here.</span></span>

<span key="794a5cfa1ed8434b980e8a065d56307d"><span offset-key="794a5cfa1ed8434b980e8a065d56307d:0">Now we can change </span>`.get()`<span offset-key="794a5cfa1ed8434b980e8a065d56307d:2"> to </span>`.getByText`<span offset-key="794a5cfa1ed8434b980e8a065d56307d:4">, </span>`.getByTestId`<span offset-key="794a5cfa1ed8434b980e8a065d56307d:6"> etc.</span></span>

## 

<span key="ba2adf458dca4627bd5c11d6b1ba275e"><span offset-key="ba2adf458dca4627bd5c11d6b1ba275e:0">5. Scripting Cypress for local development and Continuous Integration</span></span>

<span key="590fa157f25342aea1ee8872a68ace58"><span offset-key="590fa157f25342aea1ee8872a68ace58:0">In order to run Cypress we need to first run our server, and then start Cypress once that's running. It'd be convenient to be able to have the server start and Cypress then run once the server is receiving responses.</span></span>

<span key="3cdc2ad772844a27a239ebe90a10b7d6"><span offset-key="3cdc2ad772844a27a239ebe90a10b7d6:0">This is also required for CI, because we need some way to start the server, run Cypress, and then kill the server once Cypress is done.</span></span>

<span key="4492488487724dfab0cc072dc1f4136c"><span offset-key="4492488487724dfab0cc072dc1f4136c:0">We can use </span>`start-server-and-test`<span offset-key="4492488487724dfab0cc072dc1f4136c:2"> to start our server, wait for the app to be accepting requests, run Cypress, and then kill our server.</span></span>

<span key="bf0d6c7bc6da465ebf937968925c94f1"><span offset-key="bf0d6c7bc6da465ebf937968925c94f1:0">When we run Cypress on CI we don't want/need the UI. </span>`cypress run`<span offset-key="bf0d6c7bc6da465ebf937968925c94f1:2"> runs tests on Cypress without the UI.</span></span>

<span key="6592ad47fdb140f89048e730afb9cde3"><span offset-key="6592ad47fdb140f89048e730afb9cde3:0">Using </span>`is-ci`<span offset-key="6592ad47fdb140f89048e730afb9cde3:2">, </span>`start-server-and-run`<span offset-key="6592ad47fdb140f89048e730afb9cde3:4">, </span>`npm-run-all`<span offset-key="6592ad47fdb140f89048e730afb9cde3:6">, and separating our scripts we can simplify running our application and tests at the same time.</span></span>

## 

<span key="28a37af00c704eecab741337fd506130"><span offset-key="28a37af00c704eecab741337fd506130:0">6. Debug a test with Cypress</span></span>

<span key="4ee76534945441cab5f679e0572ad291"><span offset-key="4ee76534945441cab5f679e0572ad291:0">Because Cypress uses Chrome you can use dev tools to debug your tests.</span></span>

<span key="338e2c61df274ff9bf15ae39c514ab05"><span offset-key="338e2c61df274ff9bf15ae39c514ab05:0">To debug tests in Cypress, chain a </span>`.then`<span offset-key="338e2c61df274ff9bf15ae39c514ab05:2"> that accepts a subject and returns it. Inside this statement you can place a </span>`debugger`<span offset-key="338e2c61df274ff9bf15ae39c514ab05:4"> statement.</span></span>

<span key="efafa7f8e0d44984811ba4eaafb7733b"><span offset-key="efafa7f8e0d44984811ba4eaafb7733b:0">Cypress adds a </span>`Cypress`<span offset-key="efafa7f8e0d44984811ba4eaafb7733b:2"> object to the global object which can be used in tests to determine whether a file is being executed in the context of Cypress or not.</span></span>

## 

<span key="a286db8ba5e94c2691ab2ac0b28d0540"><span offset-key="a286db8ba5e94c2691ab2ac0b28d0540:0">7. Use Cypress to test user registration</span></span>

<span key="95cb80a228ab44b698a9a81730ac798c">`register.js`</span>

<span key="0fe6fac84a6b416097b251206d69b73d"><span offset-key="0fe6fac84a6b416097b251206d69b73d:0">We can automate registration by navigating to the sign up page, entering in details, and submitting the form.</span></span>

<span key="657400e455004a7d8aae4338bfc59f60"><span offset-key="657400e455004a7d8aae4338bfc59f60:0">Using </span>`test-data-bot`<span offset-key="657400e455004a7d8aae4338bfc59f60:2"> we can generate credentials for users using </span>`faker`<span offset-key="657400e455004a7d8aae4338bfc59f60:4">s API.</span></span>

<span key="15ee6a2839d24dd7aba20e25722ca5db"><span offset-key="15ee6a2839d24dd7aba20e25722ca5db:0">To have Cypress simulate a user typing out text, we use the </span>`.type('text to type')`<span offset-key="15ee6a2839d24dd7aba20e25722ca5db:2"> command once we have a subject (an element).</span></span>

<span key="eaf534e8ba31456cbe5f624f667ef2d7"><span offset-key="eaf534e8ba31456cbe5f624f667ef2d7:0">We can evaluate the current URL using </span>`.url().should('eq',                                         myUrl)`</span>

<span key="ce7f5698fd054d4aa8922958f19ad03e"><span offset-key="ce7f5698fd054d4aa8922958f19ad03e:0">Cypress provides access to config values inside tests via </span>`Cypress.config()`</span>

<span key="39558c1eb409406eafcb700a0babeb67"><span offset-key="39558c1eb409406eafcb700a0babeb67:0">We can evaluate the </span>`window`<span offset-key="39558c1eb409406eafcb700a0babeb67:2"> object using </span>`.window()`<span offset-key="39558c1eb409406eafcb700a0babeb67:4"> to make it the subject.</span></span>

<span key="ba1fd54eb147439692b507e371e01267"><span offset-key="ba1fd54eb147439692b507e371e01267:0">To evaluate properties on a subject, we use the </span>`.its('property[name]')`<span offset-key="ba1fd54eb147439692b507e371e01267:2"> command:</span></span>

## 

<span key="d41b4ab6ca894488a6902ff39cb0e6fa"><span offset-key="d41b4ab6ca894488a6902ff39cb0e6fa:0">8. Cypress Driven Development</span></span>

<span key="afdcb974a4fa40a39f590be44c1a31fd"><span offset-key="afdcb974a4fa40a39f590be44c1a31fd:0">Because Cypress can automate repetitive work, one can use it in a similar manner to test-driven-development. We can automate away repetitive work through Cypress, while having the tests validate that we're on the right path.</span></span>

<span key="a2fb7f59e24e4b1bae63f132c4d2f73c"><span offset-key="a2fb7f59e24e4b1bae63f132c4d2f73c:0">Because Cypress is running an instance of Chrome, we can do our development inside Cypress with little need for running our apps in regular browsers.</span></span>

<span key="b9e948dc4aef41fdac5899bc6b6b89dd"><span offset-key="b9e948dc4aef41fdac5899bc6b6b89dd:0">Cypress allows one to override the default timeout when resolving subjects:</span></span>

<span key="187ba098f00d4512820973eea6907463"><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="187ba098f00d4512820973eea6907463:0">...</span></span>

## 

<span key="95bb3c32231747d387bd5bb852e6d0f9"><span offset-key="95bb3c32231747d387bd5bb852e6d0f9:0">9. Simulate HTTP Errors in Cypress Tests</span></span>

<span key="53732f8ba43f46cda5adf9830fe6be87">`register.js`</span>

<span key="d766a17bab4b4fdb84c697fc72bf8ce2"><span offset-key="d766a17bab4b4fdb84c697fc72bf8ce2:0">We can stub out requests to services in Cypress so that we can evaluate what happens for different responses.</span></span>

<span key="d85207449fa84f13b57f0b80b2fb072b"><span offset-key="d85207449fa84f13b57f0b80b2fb072b:0">We need to do a few things in order to stub out requests:</span></span>

    <span key="5b01c6810e2d4468a4c8eedc0d3e0358"><span offset-key="5b01c6810e2d4468a4c8eedc0d3e0358:0">indicate to Cypress that we want to use mock server:</span></span>

<span key="341b019c4f5f42d79f5e764125f90715"><span offset-key="341b019c4f5f42d79f5e764125f90715:0">cy</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="341b019c4f5f42d79f5e764125f90715:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="341b019c4f5f42d79f5e764125f90715:2">server</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="341b019c4f5f42d79f5e764125f90715:3">()</span></span>

    <span key="2e9b99ac5fbd4f0f9d0afc223f384ae9"><span offset-key="2e9b99ac5fbd4f0f9d0afc223f384ae9:0">define which requests Cypress should stub out, and how to respond:</span></span>

## 

<span key="cb02890ba30c47ec8684c87482285887"><span offset-key="cb02890ba30c47ec8684c87482285887:0">10. Test user login with Cypress</span></span>

<span key="6ead238086d44a959e7e5defbeebb539">`login.js`</span>

<span key="5cfca18a1d8841b2920b85dcbdcfe80e"><span offset-key="5cfca18a1d8841b2920b85dcbdcfe80e:0">We can validate the log in flow using a similar approach as with </span>`register.js`<span offset-key="5cfca18a1d8841b2920b85dcbdcfe80e:2">. We don't yet have a user, so we need to first register the user, and then go through the log in flow using the same credentials.</span></span>

## 

<span key="65ce97d0f40740458a32ee4d26fbb2a6"><span offset-key="65ce97d0f40740458a32ee4d26fbb2a6:0">11. Create a user with cy.request from Cypress</span></span>

<span key="20a3092fa95c4b2aaa68ead4e5c67d15">`login.js`</span>

<span key="02d2070e26304e3ab87794ee26018972"><span offset-key="02d2070e26304e3ab87794ee26018972:0">In </span>`login.js`<span offset-key="02d2070e26304e3ab87794ee26018972:2"> we've duplicated the registration flow. This makes maintaining the tests more difficult when there are changes or errors, and we're just doing the same work again.</span></span>

<span key="47230bf626db47ff8f9fd086610040be"><span offset-key="47230bf626db47ff8f9fd086610040be:0">To get around this, we can instead make the request to the registration endpoint to register the user, and the test only the log in flow.</span></span>

<span key="a7611608b85447228893f6828d748ec7"><span offset-key="a7611608b85447228893f6828d748ec7:0">This can be achieved using </span>`cy.request(options)`<span offset-key="a7611608b85447228893f6828d748ec7:2">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="16ba845c93894df789389d94948039b9"><span offset-key="16ba845c93894df789389d94948039b9:0">12. Keep tests isolated and focused with custom Cypress commands</span></span>

<span key="755ebe76f4c94a8ba16161efc156fd67"><span offset-key="755ebe76f4c94a8ba16161efc156fd67:0">Being able to create the new user on </span>`login.js`<span offset-key="755ebe76f4c94a8ba16161efc156fd67:2"> is convenient, but if other tests need a user to be created, it can quickly become tedious to repeat the same process.</span></span>

<span key="9906c409536947dfaab349d2cab1916d"><span offset-key="9906c409536947dfaab349d2cab1916d:0">To address this, we can create a custom Cypress command in </span>`cypress/support/commands.js`<span offset-key="9906c409536947dfaab349d2cab1916d:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442"><span offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:0">Cypress</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:1">.</span><span offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:2">Command</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:3">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:4">add</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:5">(</span><span class="r-qtrn9a" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:6">'myCommand'</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:7">,</span><span offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:8"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:9">()</span><span offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:10"> </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:11">=></span><span offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:12"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="fbb95988e4c74cc4a4f0c6e937fbf442:13">{</span></span>

2

<span key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3"><span offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:0"> cy</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:1">.</span><span slate-leaf="true" offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:2">request</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:3">(</span><span offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:4">options</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="778e275be60248babde1aa260f1e2af3:5">)</span></span>

3

<span key="51c77fd16d30476890045f5b7db5df01"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="51c77fd16d30476890045f5b7db5df01:0">})</span></span>

## 

<span key="52cfee3418e84bb3a11d63d0ac4f4c1c"><span offset-key="52cfee3418e84bb3a11d63d0ac4f4c1c:0">13. Use custom Cypress command for reusable assertions</span></span>

<span key="a55a0bb8dd484b31b3cb477f512b09b5">`cypress/support.commands.js`</span>

<span key="45671b8b30c444dbad46440987b7423e"><span offset-key="45671b8b30c444dbad46440987b7423e:0">Different tests will often require the same assertions - does logging in take the user to the home page, does registration take a user to the same page?</span></span>

<span key="9e2fa9814ec6400e8a880046c11868f4"><span offset-key="9e2fa9814ec6400e8a880046c11868f4:0">Instead of writing the same assertions in multiple tests, we can move those assertions to the </span>`commands.js`<span offset-key="9e2fa9814ec6400e8a880046c11868f4:2"> file in the </span>`support`<span offset-key="9e2fa9814ec6400e8a880046c11868f4:4"> folder, and then reuse the custom commands in our tests.</span></span>

## 

<span key="e45f68e194df4de58e2b5261065c7a81"><span offset-key="e45f68e194df4de58e2b5261065c7a81:0">14. Run tests as an authenticated user with Cypress</span></span>

<span key="685ab83c414b4362bfc8aab525e8e0f1">`calculator.js`</span>

<span key="ecf025c551484069bd68406095bcd56f"><span offset-key="ecf025c551484069bd68406095bcd56f:0">We've tested the calculator for anonymous users, but we don't yet know that authenticated users will not be affected by changes to the application.</span></span>

<span key="e8a3a004de064bfd922e57162f23385b"><span offset-key="e8a3a004de064bfd922e57162f23385b:0">We can create a user, log them in, and then assert that they are in fact logged in.</span></span>

<span key="610c90268a944ae4a4fd091869c0759c"><span offset-key="610c90268a944ae4a4fd091869c0759c:0">We can then log them out, and then assert that they are in fact logged out, too.</span></span>

## 

<span key="3310d99493914ff3aabfb99b1db18704"><span offset-key="3310d99493914ff3aabfb99b1db18704:0">15. Use </span>`cy.request`<span offset-key="3310d99493914ff3aabfb99b1db18704:2"> from Cypress to authenticate as a new user</span></span>

<span key="e735a725e13f4f288e2f8d2f204e1a7c">`calculator.js`</span>

<span key="961ac64634ff459182b410bb0b4726a8"><span offset-key="961ac64634ff459182b410bb0b4726a8:0">In our last update to calculator we rewrote the log in flow that is already tested in </span>`login.js`<span offset-key="961ac64634ff459182b410bb0b4726a8:2">.</span></span>

<span key="ca46914f977b43159d3f7d33221b1500"><span offset-key="ca46914f977b43159d3f7d33221b1500:0">Instead of running through the entire flow, we can use </span>`cy.request`<span offset-key="ca46914f977b43159d3f7d33221b1500:2"> to make a request directly to the API, and then use </span>`window.localStorage`<span offset-key="ca46914f977b43159d3f7d33221b1500:4"> to set the token in </span>`localStorage`<span offset-key="ca46914f977b43159d3f7d33221b1500:6">, before running any assertions.</span></span>

## 

<span key="78a4ba18c41b435db8ab0ee3b99309a1"><span offset-key="78a4ba18c41b435db8ab0ee3b99309a1:0">16. Use a custom Cypress command to login as a user</span></span>

<span key="dc4f23754fce4927a6697b27344946eb">`commands.js`</span>

<span key="be181b543c1446ba91c3b322b9624a3a">`calculator.js`</span>

<span key="90350a54d42c4de9aa528e0f41246760"><span offset-key="90350a54d42c4de9aa528e0f41246760:0">The login request in </span>`calculator.js`<span offset-key="90350a54d42c4de9aa528e0f41246760:2"> will likely be needed by other tests, so we can create a custom command to reuse it later.</span></span>

## 

<span key="1f4dec181e814f1ab7bde2d7c04ae304"><span offset-key="1f4dec181e814f1ab7bde2d7c04ae304:0">17. Combine custom Cypress commands into a single custom command</span></span>

<span key="20a2b421d7744310b685cad960ff15a1">`commands.js`</span>

<span key="60d55c7c5e0d4a4b93f20c4e11b1f37b">`calculator.js`</span>

<span key="562b2e02b49f437fa60e2211e7622bfc"><span offset-key="562b2e02b49f437fa60e2211e7622bfc:0">To make things even smother, we can use commands within commands. Doing this we can combine creating a user and logging them in into a single step.</span></span>

## 

<span key="388870efba8f4d329f28e881b8d48be1"><span offset-key="388870efba8f4d329f28e881b8d48be1:0">18. Install React DevTools with Cypress</span></span>

<span key="193b32d6543c435fbaa8f5b20b234aac"><span offset-key="193b32d6543c435fbaa8f5b20b234aac:0">To use React Devtools in Cypress we need to first install the Chrome extension.</span></span>

<span key="fa98da8f5d6342eaa41645ab8a513e48"><span offset-key="fa98da8f5d6342eaa41645ab8a513e48:0">Once that's done, we'll only have access to the Cypress component that the Cypress UI is built with, because our application is actually running in an iframe.</span></span>

<span key="b2c90fa326f54464a6e2406146854e05"><span offset-key="b2c90fa326f54464a6e2406146854e05:0">To provide that iframe with context for Devtools to have access to components inside it, we need to set the same variable that React Devtools adds to the </span>`window`<span offset-key="b2c90fa326f54464a6e2406146854e05:2">.</span></span>

<span key="41ad4ae1ac7343c4b1db27ff3806accd"><span offset-key="41ad4ae1ac7343c4b1db27ff3806accd:0">This is </span>`window.__REACT_DEVTOOLS_GLOBAL_HOOK__`<span offset-key="41ad4ae1ac7343c4b1db27ff3806accd:2">. To provide context within the iframe, we need to set that variable to that of the parent window (where React has defined the variable):</span></span>

1

<span key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7"><span class="r-y7gyvo" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:0">if</span><span offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:1"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:2">(</span><span offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:3">window</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:4">.</span><span offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:5">Cypres</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:6">)</span><span offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:7"> </span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="00ee4d2746594aee8fb1e96b86c7b3b7:8">{</span></span>

2

<span key="6e9160bde4804ebd90815526e45791e2"><span offset-key="6e9160bde4804ebd90815526e45791e2:0"> window</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="6e9160bde4804ebd90815526e45791e2:1">.</span><span offset-key="6e9160bde4804ebd90815526e45791e2:2">\_\_REACT\_DEVTOOLS\_GLOBAL\_HOOK\_\_ </span><span class="r-11faab8" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="6e9160bde4804ebd90815526e45791e2:3">=</span></span>

3

<span key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20"><span offset-key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20:0"> window</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20:1">.</span><span offset-key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20:2">parent</span><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20:3">.</span><span offset-key="0ebadfc012964a58abe5be8cbc771b20:4">\_\_REACT\_DEVTOOLS\_GLOBAL\_HOOK\_\_</span></span>

4

<span key="14e9539ee4cb4f0cacecd0fe20b377eb"><span class="r-dyg9za" slate-leaf="true" offset-key="14e9539ee4cb4f0cacecd0fe20b377eb:0">}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="0487ae76527b4bafbd679be9181f0682"><span offset-key="0487ae76527b4bafbd679be9181f0682:0">This needs to be executed before React runs in our app.</span></span>

<span key="1364dca262b347ed9b32e419633de181"><span offset-key="1364dca262b347ed9b32e419633de181:0">Now, in addition to the Cypress app, we can inspect our own app.</span></span>

<a href="configure-jest-for-testing-javascript-applications.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>

<a href="install-configure-and-script-cypress-for-javascript-web-applications.html#18.-install-react-devtools-with-cypress" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-855088 r-dwliz8 r-1loqt21 r-18u37iz r-lqms97 r-dnmrzs r-iphfwy r-1guathk r-1h8ys4a r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr r-7xmw5f"></a>

18\. Install React DevTools with Cypress
